start.description: Ah, Twitter. Such a reputation you have. You like to see yourself as an enabler and leader of revoltions worldwide, but a lot of folks just see you as a vehicle for creepy harassment. In my life you're a vehicle for social commentary that thinks it's more cutting than it is. But twitter is definitely a tool your enemies can use to harass and even locate you.

nextSteps.prompt: I don't have a twitter, or I don't care to secure my account.

twitter.description:
Cool, you're interested in securing your twitter profile. Wise! This means you can tweet with less fear of harassment. It's also worth practicing shutting it down now, and then if you experience a sudden wave of harassment you can shut down your account temporarily (this is a common practice).
To make your twitter account private, go to your account settings on twitter.com, and select the security and privacy section.

nextSteps.prompt: Cool, I set my twitter to private!
I like to live life on the edge, and I also don't mind tweeting in a way that keeps myself and my friends info private to the extent I can.
I want to do something else now!

aww.description: You didn't lock down your twitter profile, but hopefully you'll exercise discretion!
